qas.question: In what year was the first boardwalk built in Atlantic City?
Why was the first boardwalk built in Atlantic City?

answers.text: to help hotel owners keep sand out of their lobbies

qas.question: What year was the Great Atlantic Hurricane?
What was the historic length of the boardwalk before the Great Atlantic Hurricane?
Before the Great Atlantic Hurricane the boardwalk extended from Atlantic City to what other city?

context: The first boardwalk was built in <a0_0>1870<a0_0/> along a portion of the beach in an effort <a1_0>to help hotel owners keep sand out of their lobbies<a1_0/>. Businesses were restricted and the boardwalk was removed each year at the end of the peak season. Because of its effectiveness and popularity, the boardwalk was expanded in length and width, and modified several times in subsequent years. The historic length of the boardwalk, before the destructive <a2_0>1944<a2_0/> Great Atlantic Hurricane, was <a3_0>about 7 miles<a3_0/> (11 km) and it extended from Atlantic City to <a4_0>Longport<a4_0/>, through Ventnor and Margate.
